headline: 'This is a really special team': Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine lands in LA for Super Bowl
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: Mike DeWine said several of his children and grandchildren will be flying out to Los Angeles to join them in celebrating the Super Bowl.
I don't know, I'm thinking back to 1990 Reds, which was a phenomenal, phenomenal team," DeWine said.
Mike DeWine and First Lady Fran DeWine have landed in Los Angeles ahead of the Super Bowl.
"Imagine walking in and just... game's on the line and you just do it time after time.
"Burrow's just an amazing athlete and an amazing person," Mike DeWine said.
Fran DeWine said she loves how the Super Bowl is bringing people together.
"It's just so much fun to see people happy everywhere," Fran DeWine said.
First off, Mike DeWine spoke about Bengals kicker Evan McPherson.
WLWT got to speak to the DeWines one-on-one Thursday evening.
The governor spoke highly of quarterback Joe Burrow.
"This guy's got nerves of steel," Mike DeWine said.
We haven't had anything quite like this ...
"This has to compare with that really."
This is a really special team."
